[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Command Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious shell commands through the --config, --dependency, or source file arguments that get executed when paths are processed, potentially achieving remote code execution on the benchmark runner? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Path Traversal] Can an attacker provide specially crafted config file paths like '../../../../etc/passwd' or paths with null bytes to read arbitrary files from the filesystem when Options::create_from_toml_file() is called? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Path Traversal] Does the --dependency argument properly validate and sanitize directory paths, or can an attacker use '../' sequences to traverse outside intended directories and include malicious Move files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Symlink Attack] Can an attacker create symbolic links in the dependencies or sources directories that point to sensitive system files, causing the benchmark to process and expose privileged information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [File Extension Injection] Can the extension generation logic be exploited by providing config file names with multiple dots or special characters to write output to unintended file locations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker specify an unbounded number of --config arguments to exhaust memory or create excessive file handles during parallel benchmark execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Input Validation] Does the argument parser properly validate that source files exist and are readable before processing, or can missing files cause denial of service through repeated error handling? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Logic Flaw] Can an attacker provide an empty configs vector by not specifying --config, causing the default None value to be used, potentially bypassing security configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Error Handling Bypass] When run_benchmark() returns an error, does the error message printed to stdout leak sensitive path information or internal system details that could aid further attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: benchmark()] [Race Condition] If multiple benchmark processes run concurrently with the same config file, can race conditions in file creation cause data corruption or loss in the .data/.fun_data output files? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [TOCTOU Attack] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability between when Options::create_from_toml_file() reads the config and when it's used, allowing an attacker to swap the config file with malicious content? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Arbitrary File Write] Can an attacker control the 'out' parameter to write benchmark results to arbitrary filesystem locations like /etc/cron.d/ for privilege escalation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [File Overwrite] Does File::create(out) safely handle existing files, or can it overwrite critical system files if the output path is manipulated to point to sensitive locations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Configuration Injection] Can malicious TOML in the config file exploit parsing vulnerabilities to inject arbitrary Options values that bypass security restrictions or enable dangerous features? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Resource Inclusion Attack] Does the aptos-natives inclusion at line 153-154 properly validate the embedded bytecode, or can an attacker replace this file to inject malicious Boogie code into the verification pipeline? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Integer Overflow] Can the hard_timeout_secs value of 60 be manipulated through config injection to cause integer overflow when converted to milliseconds or compared with Duration values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Timeout Bypass] Can an attacker craft Move code that causes the Boogie verifier to hang indefinitely despite the 60-second hard timeout, potentially through solver bugs or infinite loops? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Race Condition] Is there a race condition between options.set_quiet() and options.setup_logging() that could cause sensitive debug information to leak to unauthorized output streams? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Directory Traversal] When move_sources and move_deps are appended from user input, are the paths canonicalized to prevent '..' traversal attacks that could access restricted directories? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Memory Exhaustion] Does skip_attribute_checks = true disable critical memory safety validations, allowing malicious Move files to cause unbounded memory allocation during parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Format String Vulnerability] Can the config_descr string derived from user-controlled config file names be exploited in the writeln! macro calls to cause format string attacks or information disclosure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Timestamp Manipulation] Can chrono::Utc::now() be influenced by system time changes to falsify benchmark timestamps, potentially hiding malicious benchmarking activity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Error Propagation] Does check_errors() properly sanitize error messages before writing to error_writer, or can malicious Move code inject escape sequences or ANSI codes to manipulate terminal output? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: run_benchmark()] [Concurrency Violation] Does proc_cores = 1 enforcement actually prevent parallel execution, or can malicious configs override this to cause race conditions in single-threaded assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Function: bench()] [Module Filtering Bypass] Can an attacker craft Move modules that report is_target() as true but contain malicious code, bypassing the target filtering and executing unauthorized operations? (High)
